Description.Name: If you build it...
Description.Details: You hear a knock on the door to your office, "Enter," you call out as you press the OPEN button on your desk. The door slides back to reveal Dr Murad and Sumire. They both stride in and begin talking at once, "Commander, we have..." You hold up your hand, "One at a time, please!" They look at each other before Sumire turns to you, "Commander, we have just acquired all the components to put together a KF Console." You raise your eyebrows, "What, pray tell, is a KF Console?" Sumire smiles, "Well, it is... umm, well... it is pirate tech and from what other navigators have told me, it is a way to potentially use [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePiratePoint],Pirate Points]] to get to systems quicker." Your brow wrinkles, "Do I really have to remind you that the Argo is not jump capable, it is a giant dropship?" Dr Murad smiles, "Yes, the Argo is a dropship, but it is massive, and has very powerful engines. Although the KF Console is supposed to be installed on a jumpship, I have a way to install it on the Argo." You still look confused, "Without a Kearny-Fuchida drive, we still need to use jumpships for travel. So I fail to see how this console thingy will benefit us at all." Dr Murad taps her datapad and sends images and schematics onto the screen on the wall in your office, "The basic premise is this, Commander. With an activated KF Console onboard the Argo, we can send data to whichever jumpship we have docked with and substitute their NavCom data with that generated by the Console. This will mean the jumpship will then arrive at a pirate point of the system we are going to." You steeple your fingers in front of you, "You think you can just convice a Jumpship Captain to risk using a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePiratePoint],pirate point]]?' Dr Murad speaks up, "Actually, the navigator will never even know their coordinates have been replaced. They will most likely assume there was a system malfunction or something. The chances of us being singled out as the cause are slim." You shake your head, "Still sounds a lot like using a virus to deliver data to a computer that does not belong to us. What if we do [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMisjump],misjump]]? What then?" Dr Murad clears her throat, "Well, there is always a risk of a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreMisjump],misjump]] regardless of whether a [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LorePiratePoint],pirate point]] is used or not. Aside from the absolute worst case scenario, total structural implosion, my research suggests that if we were to misjump from the use of the Console, it would either fling us to an uncharted system, we could sustain damage to the Argo's engines, or a combination of both." Sumire looks at you, "How do you wish to proceed, Commander?"

Description.Name: Install KF Console
Description.Details: Install the Console for [Â¢2,000,000, Requires Argo: Pirate Harness Drive Upgrade]

Description.Name: Install the Console
Description.Details:
You look at Sumire, "So how does it work? Does it at least have an off switch?"

Sumire consults her datapad, "The short version is that the console, when active, will start running calculations based on nearby systems and the system we are currently in.  When we enter in a system destination, it uses the data already calculated to try and discern the pirate point, if it exists, of the system we are wishing to travel to.  It will send this data without any prompting by us to the JumpShip we are docked with.  If all goes well then we jump and arrive a few days sooner than expected."

You think about it and consider the options, "Ok.  You two begin work on getting the KF Console built and let's see if we get any benefits from it."

Sumire and Dr Murad smile, "Right away, Commander!"

You stop them as they are about to leave your office, "If things go south, or it doesn't help us, I want it deactivated and not used again."

They respond in unison, "Understood, Commander!"

Description.Name: Postpone Installation
Description.Details:
You think about it and consider the options, "I think we need to wait.  Get back to me in 30 days and we can discuss this again."

Saddened, Sumire and Dr Murad turn and leave your office.

Description.Name: We don't need this Pirate jank
Description.Details: Opt out of KF Console installation

Description.Name: Decline Installation
Description.Details:
You lean back into your chair, "I am not really too keen on this.  It doesn't seem to fit with how we run this company."

Both Sumire and Dr Murad appeal, "But Commander, less time in space means more time in system!"

You shake your head, "But not at the cost of potentially destroying or stranding a JumpShip.  We do not need to get blacklisted by the MRB or the Commercial Jumpship Travel Association.  My decision is no.  Jetison those parts."
